file_content.text: Well, Councillors. Looks like it's just you and your angry constituency now.
With the Empire gone, we can start to rebuild. Corellia thanks you.
I've done all I can. Freeing Corellia is up to the Republic now.
I'm a common criminal now. You and I have nothing to say to each other.
Acting CorSec command can arrest heads of state with the Republic's approval. I want all of them. Councillor Belos, too.
But... I spied on the Empire. I lied to a Sith Lord. I risked my life to help the Republic!
You were the first to suggest we join the Empire, Belos. How many credits were you offered to change your mind?
Is this true, Councillor Belos?
I didn't know that.
The Empire made overtures, and I introduced them to the council. Does that even matter now?
It does to me. It matters to every man, woman and child who died trying to undo it.
You might want to switch sides while there's still time.
The Empire's losing.
Not all of us are as fickle as Councillor Belos. We believe in the Empire.
You might win back Corellia, but the Empire will win the war. We chose the side that will survive.
Half of Corellia is in ruins because you refuse to change yours.
At least he helped.
No one expected the transition to be easy. But the Republic turned some minor resistance into an all-out war.
The real Corellia rioted in the streets. CorSec launched full-scale attacks on the Empire. There was nothing minor about it.
How can you defend joining the Empire?
You're a hypocrite.
You may be too young to remember the Sacking of Coruscant, but we're not. The Republic didn't have a chance.
Which planet do you think would have been next? We did what was best for Corellia.
How many credits were you offered to keep it?
You're one to talk.
We joined the Empire only to save Corellia.
The Empire has resources and proven strength. We were planning for the future.
You can argue with each other in jail.
Everyone shut up.
Corellia is not a democracy. Joining the Empire didn't require the people's approval.
You have no right to arrest us. We acted well within the confines of the law.
The council made themselves kings at Corellia's expense. They all deserve to be punished.
Councillor Belos got us here. He's more than made up for it.
Belos goes free.
I don't know if I'll ever make up for it. But I won't let a chance to try go to waste. Thank you.
I appreciate what he did for us, but you just let a traitor go free.
You all started this war. Nothing can make up for that.
Lock them all up.
Take note, Captain Cantarus. This is how the Republic repays her allies.
Only the ones who join the Empire, Councillor.
General Aves will want a status update. Give us a minute to restore communications in here. Can you hear us, General?
Coming through fine, Captain. Without the Corellian Council's advice, the Empire's falling back on old tactics. They're not working.
Once the Legislature falls, the Empire will be vulnerable. I've got several squads ready to push them off Corellia, but they'll need a signal.
Broadcast comm in the Speaker's Courtyard. Your signal will hit every comm station on Corellia--if you can reach it.
What's the Speaker's Courtyard?
Speaker's Courtyard?
The Legislature's open-air garden. Every big speech in Corellian history was made there.
I can reach it.
If the Imperials get the signal, they'll have time to prepare.
This sounds risky.
It'll be too late. Once the Legislature falls, the Republic will have control. But we have to get there first.
The Speaker's Courtyard is being protected by Darth Decimus, the last of the Dark Council members sent to Corellia.
He convinced the Corellian Council to join the Empire. He won't let Corellia go easy.
You won't have any backup here. CorSec's holding the council, the Green Jedi are defending their enclave, and my men are in position.
Darth Decimus won't expect an ambush.
Don't worry about us.
He'll be prepared for one. Don't let his men distract you.
I didn't come this far to lose Corellia now.
That won't stop me.
Glad to hear it. But remember Darth Decimus is thinking the same thing.
I'll have the Force on my side.
A Jedi is never alone.
Just remember it only takes one good shot to kill someone, Jedi or no.
I'm a soldier. It's not my first suicide mission.
Business as usual.
Hopefully it won't be your last.
I've been saving a few tricks for a fight like this.
I'll get by somehow.
Use everything you've got. If we lose the Legislature, we lose Corellia.
Whatever it takes to beat the Empire.
You're in command.
Reinforcements are dead weight anyway.
And good riddance.
Let's hope that works both ways. Every Imperial we didn't catch will be holed up inside.
Once you've defeated Darth Decimus, contact me on the broadcast comm. I'll be waiting for your signal.
This is it. One Sith Lord between us and freedom. Corellia's counting on you.
Deal with Darth Hadra first. Then we can talk.
